All State/UT Administration/ Nodal/Line Departments/ SDAs  Implementing Agency : CSC e-Governance Services India Ltd ( CSC SPV) 2. All Associated Nodal Ministries/Departments and Associated Public Authorities Implementation Guidelines for CSC 2.0 – A Way Forward Title: Guidelines for implementation of “Common Services Centre 2.0 – A way forward” under Abstract: This document is intended for State Governments/UT Administrations and District Administrations as guidance for executing the CSC 2.0-A way Forward in the States/UTs. The document describes CSC 2.0 along with its objectives, governance mechanism, role and CSC 2.0, approved in August 2015, aims to establish self sustaining network of 2.5 lakhs CSC centres at Gram Panchayat (GP) level under Digital India- Pillar 3-Public Internet Access Programme – National Rural Internet Mission and deliver various citizen centric services. The model of CSC 2.0 is envisaged as transaction based and service delivery based model, delivering a large bouquet of e-services through a single delivery technological platform, which would increase Page 3 of 20

Page 5 of 20 Implementation Guidelines for CSC 2.0 – A Way Forward 3.2 Initially the Common Service Centre Scheme was approved by the Government of India in 4.1 Digital India is a highly ambitious programme to prepare India for a knowledge future 3.1 National e-Governance Plan (NeGP) launched in 2006 consists of 44 Mission Mode 3.3 The objective of the CSC is to provide e-services in the locality of citizens, by creating the 4.2 The CSC 2.0 envisages establishment of at least 2.5 lakhs CSCs covering all Gram grass root level with the ultimate objective to bring public services closer to the citizens. envisaged to be a Change Instrument that would provide a structured platform for socially- functioning as a Change Agent, would run the CSC. It is the community participation and with a focus on three areas: Digital Infrastructure as a Utility to Every Citizen; Governance model with a large bouquet of services made available at the CSCs for delivering to the Projects (MMPs). The CSC is one of the 44 MMPs which deliver all the e-services at the September 2006 under NeGP. The scheme aimed for the establishment of one lakhs ICT enabled front-end service delivery outlets, equitably spread across rural India in the ratio of one CSC per six villages, thereby covering all six lakhs villages. CSCs were envisaged as internet enabled centres allowing access of government, private and social services to physical service delivery infrastructure for accessing various e-services . The CSC is inclusive community participation for development. An individual or organization collective action, not ICT alone, which would lead to sustainable socio-economic & Services on Demand; Digital Empowerment of Citizens. The programme has nine strong pillars and CSC 2.0 is being implemented under the pillar 3-“Public Internet Access Panchayats of the country over a period of four years. This would also include strengthening and integrating the existing one lakh CSCs already operational under the existing CSC Scheme and making operational an additional 1.5 lakhs CSCs at Gram Panchayat (preferably at GP premises). It is envisaged as a service/transaction oriented This would also include strengthening and integrating the existing one lakh CSCs already operational under the existing CSC Scheme and making operational an additional 1.5 lakhs CSCs at Gram Panchayat (preferably at GP premises). It is envisaged as a service/transaction oriented It is envisaged as a service/transaction oriented

The location and extension of Help Desk to State/UTs (as may be deemed necessary) would be managed by CSC SPV and supported by State/UT Administration wherever required. The Helpdesk will provide information and handholding support for establishing CSCs and further, this will also handle/address VLE concerns and grievances, and provide support for rendering services and for other operational issues. Implementation Guidelines for CSC 2.0 – A Way Forward Page 16 of 20 9.1.4 The State/UT has the option to set up the CSCs at desired locations including at urban or 9.1.5 Wherever location of the CSC is likely to be decided by Third Party it would be duly The CSC 2.0 is proposed to be implemented and made operational over a period of 48 months. By the end of the project, it is expected that at least one (more preferred) self sustaining CSC will be available in each Gram Panchayat successfully delivering e-services to citizens. Detailed The State/UT Administration would empower the DeGS for selection of VLEs through suitable mechanism. The State/ UT Administration and District Administration would be suitably supported by CSC SPV in this regard. The State/UT would have the flexibility of selecting the VLEs for setting up of CSC Network at the Gram Panchayat level under various combinations as suitable to the prevailing conditions. For the purpose of selection of VLEs in the region the State/UTs may invite application through DeGS or SDA and select the VLEs through a panel chaired by DM/DC heading DeGS and other members like- representatives of NIC (District Informatics Officer-DIO), CSC-SPV or any other member. However, the VLEs after selection would be functioning under DeGS. In order to empower the women, preference may be given to women as VLEs. Necessary policy guidelines may be issued by the State/UT The DeGS would have to ensure that VLE will be linked with proper Aadhaar authentications location suggested by DeGS. These CSCs, at urban or semi-urban areas, would be over and above the CSCs proposed in CSC 2.0 at Gram Panchayat level. These additional CSCs would be operational through universal CSC technological platform and would be covered under the monitoring and assessment approved by DeGS under District Collector/Magistrate. Implementation Guidelines for CSC 2.0 – A Way Forward The CSC 2.0 has been designed to ensure delivery of online services through ICT enabled access points. It is expected that the operations and management of the CSC Scheme will be self- 11.1 All the aspects related to finance, accounting and expenditures for implementation of CSC 11.2 It is expected that commission/service charges will be paid for each service successfully 11.3 In order to ensure the financial sustainability of CSCs a large bouquet of G2C, B2C, Page 17 of 20 The CSC 2.0 gives lot of importance to training and capacity building of VLEs for making them self sustaining and running a successful business at CSC outlet. Therefore, it is proposed to undertake compulsory “Entrepreneurship Training” covering all the VLEs at least once during the period of implementation. This would also include covering existing VLEs. CSC SPV would be required to undertake the training workshops across the nation with co- ordination of State/UT and District administrative machinery under the aegis & collaboration rendered at a CSC to VLE through online process immediately. For increasing the sustainability of VLEs, CSC 2.0 recommends that revenue sharing between VLE and other stake-holders is in ratio of 80:20.
